turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Did I ever tell you about how...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The maple tree and the Buick. We heard it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I think someone hasn't.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: But the real story is how I got the car. You see...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Dad?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Son?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Can we talk?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Do you know much about icebergs, Dad?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Do I? I saw an iceberg once. They were hauling it down to Texas for drinking water, only they didn't count on an elephant being frozen inside. The woolly kind. A mammoth.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm trying to make a metaphor here.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Then you shouldn't have started with a question. Because people want to answer questions. You should have started with, "The thing about icebergs is..."

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The thing about icebergs is you only see 10 percent of them. The other 90 percent is below the water where you can't see it. And that's what it is with you Dad. I'm only seeing this little bit that sticks above the water.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What, you're seeing down to my nose? My chin?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I have no idea who you are because you have never told me a single fact.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I've told you a thousand facts. That's all I do, Will. I tell stories.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You tell lies, Dad. You tell amusing lies. Stories are what you tell a five-year old at bedtime. They're not elaborate mythologies you maintain when your son is ten and fifteen and twenty and thirty. And the thing is, I believed you. I believed your stories so much longer than I should have. And then when I realized that everything you said was impossible -- everything! -- I felt like such a fool to have trusted you. You were like Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny combined. Just as charming and just as fake.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You think I'm fake.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Only on the surface. But that's all I've ever seen.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Dad, I'm about to have a kid of my own here. It would kill me if he went through his whole life never understanding me.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It would kill you, huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What do you want, Will? Who do you want me to be?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yourself. Good, bad, everything. Just show me who you are for once.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I have been nothing but myself since the day I was born. And if you can't see that, it's your failing, not mine.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The river.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The river?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Tell me how it happens.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How what happens?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: How I go.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I can try, Dad. If you help. Just tell me how it starts.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Like this.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Okay. Okay.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Somehow, you're better. Different. You're getting ready to go. And I say...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Where are we headed?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You say...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The River!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's unbelievable.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Story of my life.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You become what you always were. A very big fish.  And that's the way it happens.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes. Exactly.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Don't need to apologize to me. I mean, I'm the luckiest person you're going to find today...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: But you're wrong. I do know you, at least by reputation. Edward Bloom from Ashton. See, I'm actually engaged to a boy from Ashton. Don Price. He was a few years older than you.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Daffodils?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: They're your favorite flower.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: How did you get so many?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I called everywhere in five states and explained this was the only way I could get my wife to marry me.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: You don't even know me.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I have the rest of my life to find out.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: How can I convince you to stop?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Go out with me.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I was drying out.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I see. We need to get you one of those plant misters. We can spray you like a fern.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Wait! I need those!

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: There is no softer ground than town.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: I've been working on this poem for 12 years.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: There's a lot of expectation. I don't want to disappoint my fans.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: This is why you don't show work in progress.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Norther, do you ever regret not making it to Paris?

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: I can't imagine any place better than here.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're a poet. You oughta be able to. And maybe if you'd seen more, you could.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: It's me. Norther Winslow.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I was astonished to see the greatest poet of both Ashton and Spectre all the way out in Texas.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I don't believe it!

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: I want you to know, when you left Spectre it opened my eyes. There was a whole life out there that I was not living. So I travelled. I saw France, and Africa, half of South America. Every day a new adventure, that's my motto.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: That's great, Norther. I'm happy for you. I can't believe I helped.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: So what are you up to now?

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: I'm robbing this place.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: This is it? The whole vault.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: 'Fraid so.

turns.speaker: NORTHER WINSLOW
turns.text: Edward, it's got your deposit slip on it.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Oh. Oh.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I wasn't expecting you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you Jenny Hill?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I am. And you're Will. I've seen your picture, that's how I recognize you. I almost said something at the store, but it would have been awkward.  Like this.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How did you know my father?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: This was on his sales route, so he was through here all the time. Everyone in town knew him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Were you and my father having an affair?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Wow. Wow, you just said it. I was expecting to dance around this for another half hour.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I've seen him with women. He flirts. He always has. On some level, I presumed he was cheating on my mother. I just never had proof.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Can I ask you a question? Why did you come here today? If you found this deed, why didn't you just ask Eddie?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Because he's dying.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Look, I don't know how much you want to know about any of this. You have one image of your father and it would be wrong for me to go and change it. Especially this late in the game.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My father talked about a lot of things he never did, and I'm sure he did a lot of things he never talked about. I'm just trying to reconcile the two.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Logically, you couldn't be the Witch, because she was old back when he was young.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: No, it's logical if you think like your father. See, to him, there's only two women: your mother and everyone else.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You didn't become crazy.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Well, therapy. And one day I realized I was in love with a man who could never love me back. I was living in a fairy tale.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Thank you. I'll bet you need to --

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Down the hall on the right. The door sticks. You have to really pull it.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I spent a week in Morocco for the story. It was incredible.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: We'll have to pick up a copy.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I'm going to get started on dishes.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I'll help you.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I'm going to check on him.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I need to lie down for a bit.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I'm sorry. It seems every hour I have to...

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I know. It was the same when I was carrying Will. Like clockwork.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Do you like it, being pregnant?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I loved it. It sounds peculiar, but I loved every minute of it. I did. Eddie was travelling a lot, so he was gone, but I felt like I always had a piece of him with me. A little part of his soul inside me. I could feel it. It was alive and kicking.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: It's bad.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's more than they thought. They're going to stop chemo.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You need to go.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Probably tonight.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I'm going with you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You don't have to.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I'm going with you.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I talked with your father last night.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You never told me how your parents met.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: They met at Auburn.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: What about the details? How they fell in love. The Circus. The War. You never told me any of that.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That's because most of it never happened.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: But it's romantic.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Mmm, what?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mmm, what. I know better than to argue romance with a French woman.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Do you love your father?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Everyone loves my father. He's a very likeable guy.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Do you love him?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You have to understand. When I was growing up, he was gone more than he was here. And I started thinking -- maybe he has a second life somewhere else. With another house, another family. He leaves us, he goes to them. Or maybe there is no family. Maybe he never wanted a family. But whatever it is, maybe he likes that second life better. And the reason he tells all those stories is because he can't stand this boring place.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: But it's not true.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What is "true?" I've never heard my father say a single true thing.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Look, I know why you like him. I know why everyone likes him. But I need you to tell me I'm not crazy.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: You're not.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I need you on my side.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: I am always on your side. And I think you should talk to him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Your father had a stroke. He's upstairs with your mom and Dr. Bennett.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Is he going to be okay?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: How did you get here?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We swam. The Atlantic, it's not that big really.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Ruth McHibbon offered to pick you up at the airport.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We rented a car.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: You didn't need to do that. You just didn't.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Is that Dr. Bennett's car?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: He's up with your father.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: He's impossible. He won't eat. And because he won't eat, he gets weaker. And because he's weaker, he doesn't want to eat.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How much time does he have left?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: You don't talk about those things. Not yet.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I don't know if you've seen it, but Josephine has some photos in the most recent Newsweek.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Really! That's wonderful.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mom, would you say you understand Dad?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What I mean is, do you really know what's going on in his head?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How is that possible? I mean, you try to ask him a question and suddenly it's another one of his stories.  You can't honestly say you know him.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Yes, Will, I do. And don't presume things you don't know.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Would you say you understand Josephine?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yes. But that's a different...

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: No it's not. It's exactly the same. Your father and I met, we dated, and we married -- we chose each other -- because we understood each other on some fundamental level. Just the same as you two.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Josephine and I have a lot in common.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Yes, you both think William Bloom is a very smart man.  The problem is, you only see me as your mother, and not as someone's wife. And I've been his wife longer than I've been your mother. You can't discount that.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: True. But I've known him my whole life, and I don't feel like I know him at all. Or ever will.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I know it's not easy. Just remember, he didn't choose to be your father and you didn't choose to be his son. You just ended up together. You could pick numbers out of a dark bag and it'd be just the same. If you ask me, it's a wonder parents and children can stand each other at all.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: But I understand you, Mom. I always have.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Well, clearly you don't. But I'm not the mystery you're trying to solve right now.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Before I forget, your father has papers in the basement I'd like you to go through. I wouldn't know what's important.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mom, do you know who that is? Blonde hair.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Was she one of your teachers?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No. But it's weird. She seemed to recognize me.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Do you know who that is?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That really happened?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Not everything your father says is a complete fabrication.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Is he awake?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: He just fell asleep. Josephine's with him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Did you and Dad have any other property?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I suppose your grandmother's house when she passed on. But we sold that right away. Your cousin Shirley bought it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: So you never bought any land.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Heavens no. We had a hard enough time keeping the mortgage on this place.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I don't suppose one of us could stay with him. In case he...  In case he wakes up, one of us should be there.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'll stay. Why don't you go home with Josephine and I'll stay tonight.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: That's okay?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mom, do you want some time with Dad?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Yes. Thank you.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: You first.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Fifty thousand. Almost exactly.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Put it in the cases. Split it up. And don't forget you owe me £150.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: You know what for.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: No I don't.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: I got you those trousers from Paul Smith.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I've been buying you stuff all week. I've been buying him stuff all week.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: When we went to the Hard Rock Cafe. Who paid? When we went to see 'Cats'. Who paid?

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Those aren't presents. That's normal friendship stuff

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I paid for those guitar cases.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Yeah it was okay.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Yeah. It was quite good actually. Some bits I really liked.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: The sets were good.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: The sets were excellent. Everything was big, you know, all the rubbish, coke cans, sweet wrappers, dustbins, so when you were watching it you felt cat size. It was really clever.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Sixty four thousand, eight hundred.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: There's over eighty thousand here.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's enough isn't it?

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You know what I mean babe, It's enough. We can stop.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Do you want to stop?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: We'll stop then.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It's nothing. I burnt myself.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: That's not a burn.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: It is. I did it cooking.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Do you like it?

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Say thank you.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You heard what I said. I'm pregnant. I've been throwing up for weeks.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: A baby? What are we supposed to do with a baby?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Name it.

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: What? What are you doing?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: What. You're what? You're with this creep now.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Leave him!

turns.speaker: ALEXEI
turns.text: You have. You've actually fallen for this prick.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No I haven't.

turns.speaker: BRANCH MANAGER
turns.text: This is sensitive. Your car. Lovely car. Doesn't necessarily give the right impression.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Ch...

turns.speaker: BRANCH MANAGER
turns.text: To customers approaching the bank from the rear

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BRANCH MANAGER
turns.text: You can see why it's sensitive?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh... Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: BRANCH MANAGER
turns.text: I thought you could give us the tour this morning. Sort of be our Indian Guide.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: How's that? We can't drink our piss can we?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hang on hang on, sorry, but like, who are you?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You must find some glasses, small, for the toast, and some plates.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Sorry. You've lost me...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm asking what you're here for.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He says he feels safe here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I need to know who you are first please.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Oh.  We are Russian.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yes. I know.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And...

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: And what? You mean from the beginning? Jesus. Can I uh okay, as we say in Russia can I cut a long story short. Okay. Nadia is my little cousin. Except she's not. But we say cousin. This is for you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Toast first then we talk seriously, I can see you are serious about us.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So hang on. You're both Nadia's cousins?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Of course not. Alexei, he's is my problem.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: We better watch him. He's crazy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I am actor, he is actor, although he is an actor stroke musician. I just noodle along, I'm not so good. He makes me look like a retard -- He smokes me. I don't mean he smokes me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Right. So I can say he smokes me. So.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: So I come to England with other actors to make shows, I meet this freak from Novgorod I tell him of you and Chicken and the birthday here we are.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I asked her if you were happy to see us. I find it hard to tell with you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yes it's okay. Thank you for the food.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So how long will you be in England?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Plans are for the architects, politicians and so forth.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You must have a visa or something...

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You're asking for my documents?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, no...

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: She says 'Hello' to you. Go for it John!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh. Do you like England?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Classic!  Thank God. She says 'Yes!'

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: She says she has a secret to tell.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: "I saw you waiting there, by the gate."

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: "I have these uh..." She explains to you... "When I was a little girl my father had these beautiful old glasses." Like... I don't know the word. Like for watching uh... for watching the birds.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Binoculars.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Binoculars. He had these Binoculars he has kept from the war.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Oh nothing.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: No. It is too judgmental.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Tell me what he said.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He says why did you send to Russia for a wife.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You are not ashamed of it? It's no surprise to want to love.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No. It's not that.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Do you believe in love?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I suppose it's... I mean define your terms.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: It's very strange. How many people are truly themselves with their love? It is the greatest human disaster and it is never in the newspapers. There are no Marches Against Heartache, no Ministries Against Loneliness, no Concerts Against Disappointment. We look away. And still we know in secret that nothing is more important to us. The one thing we all share but don't say. Look John I will show you something.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: How is bank?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Fine. I thought you were leaving today.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: To be indoors on such a day. It's crime.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I understand. I'm so sorry

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You can stay tonight.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I have brought you trouble. Maybe I should have come alone.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Put the fucking kettle down.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Put the fucking kettle down. Tell, Yuri, tell him put it down or I'm going to make him.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He says you scare him so much he must go to the toilet in his trousers. John, he is a soldier. A trained killer. We must do what he says.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What? What does he want?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What did he say? Tell me!

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He says you are very sad ridiculous man. I don't agree of course. And that you must pay someone to have sex like a prostitute. Nadia is a prostitute. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What does he want. The Russian shithead. What do you want ?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: He wants money.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Tell him to put the kettle down and I'll give him money.
